args.query: continuous bijection compact Hausdorff homeomorphism mathlib4 theorem name continuous_bijective_compact_hausdorff homeomorph_of_compact_space mathlib4

args.content:
import Mathlib

/-!
A continuous bijection f : X → Y from a compact space X to a Hausdorff space Y is a homeomorphism.
-/

theorem continuous_bijective_compact_hausdorff_homeomorph {X Y : Type*} [TopologicalSpace X] [TopologicalSpace Y]
  [CompactSpace X] [T2Space Y] {f : X → Y} (hf : Continuous f) (hb : Bijective f) : Homeomorph X Y := by sorry

import Mathlib

/-!
A continuous bijection f : X → Y from a compact space X to a Hausdorff space Y is a homeomorphism.
-/

theorem continuous_bijective_compact_hausdorff_homeomorph {X : Type _} {Y : Type _} [TopologicalSpace X]
  [TopologicalSpace Y] [CompactSpace X] [T2Space Y] {f : X → Y} (hf : Continuous f) (hb : Function.Bijective f) : Homeomorph X Y := by sorry

args.natural_language_statement: A continuous bijection f : X → Y from a compact space X to a Hausdorff space Y is a homeomorphism.

args.content:
import Mathlib

/-!
A continuous bijection f : X → Y from a compact space X to a Hausdorff space Y is a homeomorphism.
-/

theorem continuous_bijective_compact_hausdorff_homeomorph {X : Type u} {Y : Type v}
  [TopologicalSpace X] [TopologicalSpace Y] [CompactSpace X] [T2Space Y]
  {f : X → Y} (hf : Continuous f) (hb : Function.Bijective f) : X ≃ₜ Y := by sorry

import Mathlib

variable {X Y : Type*} [TopologicalSpace X] [TopologicalSpace Y] [CompactSpace X] [T2Space Y]

/-- A continuous bijection from a compact space to a Hausdorff (T2) space is a homeomorphism. -/
theorem continuous_bijective_compact_to_t2_homeomorphism {f : X → Y} (hf : Continuous f) (hf_bij : Bijective f) : Homeomorph X Y := by sorry

import Mathlib

/-!
A continuous bijection f : X → Y from a compact space X to a Hausdorff space Y is a homeomorphism.
-/

universe u v

theorem continuous_bijective_compact_hausdorff_homeomorph {X : Type u} {Y : Type v}
  [TopologicalSpace X] [TopologicalSpace Y] [CompactSpace X] [T2Space Y]
  {f : X → Y} (hf : Continuous f) (hb : Function.Bijective f) : Homeomorph X Y := by sorry

import Mathlib

variable {X Y : Type _} [TopologicalSpace X] [TopologicalSpace Y] [CompactSpace X] [T2Space Y]

/-- A continuous bijection from a compact space to a Hausdorff (T2) space is a homeomorphism. -/
theorem continuous_bijective_compact_to_t2_homeomorphism {f : X → Y} (hf : Continuous f) (hf_bij : Function.Bijective f) : Homeomorph X Y := by sorry

args.query: mathlib4 Hausdorff T2Space CompactSpace Homeomorph theorem continuous bijection compact Hausdorff homeomorphism Mathlib4 name

args.content:
import Mathlib

/-
A continuous bijection f : X → Y from a compact space X to a Hausdorff space Y is a homeomorphism.
We state existence of a continuous inverse (hence a homeomorphism).
-/

universe u v

theorem continuous_bijective_compact_hausdorff_homeomorph {X : Type u} {Y : Type v}
  [TopologicalSpace X] [TopologicalSpace Y] [CompactSpace X] [T2Space Y]
  {f : X → Y} (hf : Continuous f) (hb : Function.Bijective f) :
  ∃ g : Y → X, Continuous g ∧ (g ∘ f = id) ∧ (f ∘ g = id) := by sorry

import Mathlib

variable (X Y : Type*) [TopologicalSpace X] [TopologicalSpace Y] [CompactSpace X] [T2Space Y]

/-- A continuous bijection from a compact space to a Hausdorff (T2) space is a homeomorphism. -/
theorem continuous_bijective_compact_to_t2_homeomorphism (f : X → Y) (hf : Continuous f) (hf_bij : Function.Bijective f) : Homeomorph X Y := by sorry

import Mathlib

variable {X Y : Type _} [TopologicalSpace X] [TopologicalSpace Y] [CompactSpace X] [T2Space Y]

/-- A continuous bijection from a compact space to a Hausdorff (T2) space is a homeomorphism. -/
theorem continuous_bijective_compact_to_t2_homeomorphism (f : X → Y) (hf : Continuous f) (hf_bij : Function.Bijective f) : Homeomorph X Y := by
  sorry

import Mathlib

variable {X Y : Type _} [TopologicalSpace X] [TopologicalSpace Y] [CompactSpace X] [T2Space Y]

/-- A continuous bijection from a compact space to a Hausdorff (T2) space has a continuous inverse. -/
theorem continuous_bijective_compact_to_t2_has_continuous_inverse (f : X → Y) (hf : Continuous f) (hf_bij : Function.Bijective f) :
  ∃ g : Y → X, Continuous g ∧ Function.LeftInverse g f ∧ Function.RightInverse g f := by
  sorry
